section.title: The variable element information item
section.para: Variable element information items (referred to in this specification as variable elements) are element information items in the CellML 1.1 or CellML 1.2 namespace with local name equal to variable, and which appear as a child of a component element.
Software that generates CellML SHOULD use the CellML 1.1 namespace except when the type attribute is required.

section.title: Specific information items when element in the CellML 1.2 namespace

listitem.para:
Every variable element MUST have each of the following attribute information item in the empty namespace:
The name attribute. The value of the name attribute MUST be a valid CellML Identifier. The value of the name attribute MUST NOT be identical to the name attribute on any sibling variable element.

Every variable element MAY contain one or more of the following attribute information items in the empty namespace:
The public_interface attribute. If the attribute is present, it MUST have value yes or no.
The private_interface attribute. If the attribute is present, it MUST have value yes or no.
The initial_value attribute. If the attribute is present, it MUST meet the requirements described in .
The type attribute. If the attribute is present, the value MUST be a URI. The URI MAY be http://www.cellml.org/cellml/1.2#real, which SHALL be interpreted as indicating that the variable is real valued. If the attribute is absent, this should be treated as if the URI was http://www.cellml.org/cellml/1.2#real. In either of these two cases, the units attribute MUST be present.
The units attribute. If the attribute is present, the value MUST be a valid CellML Identifier, and MUST meet the constraints described in .

section.title: Specific information items when element in the CellML 1.1 namespace

listitem.para:
Every variable element MUST have each of the following attribute information items in the empty namespace:
The name attribute. The value of the name attribute MUST be a valid CellML Identifier. The value of the name attribute MUST NOT be identical to the name attribute on any sibling variable element.
The units attribute. If the attribute is present, the value MUST be a valid CellML Identifier, and MUST meet the constraints described in .

Every variable element MAY contain one or more of the following attribute information items in the empty namespace:
The public_interface attribute. If the attribute is present, it MUST have value in, out, or none. CellML processing software SHALL treat the attribute values in and out the same way that the value yes is treated for variable elements in the CellML 1.2 namespace, and SHALL treat none in the same way that no is treated.
The private_interface attribute. If the attribute is present, it MUST have value yes or no. CellML processing software SHALL treat the attribute values in and out the same way that the value yes is treated for variable elements in the CellML 1.2 namespace, and SHALL treat none in the same way that no is treated.
The initial_value attribute. If the attribute is present, it MUST meet the requirements described in .
